comment.author: 43854658@N00
comment._content: The engagement of Miss Mildred Hardy (1898-1983), a daughter of Congressman Rufus Hardy (1855-1943), of Texas, to Mr. William (W. L.) Taggart of Washington, D.C. was announced on January 16, 1921.  Mr. W. L. Taggart was a son of Hugh T. Taggart, former assistant Attorney General. They were married on February 21, 1921. — New York Tribune,  [1] Mildred Hardy studied at the Art Students League of New York (with Henri) (1916-1917). She studied at the Corcoran School of Art and the Abbott School of Fine and Commercial Art in Washington, DC. A renowned artist, her paintings were displayed in Washington's National Gallery among others. [2] Mildred Hardy Taggert and her husband lived in Chevy Chase, Maryland. They were divorced in 1950. They had two daughters, Julie Ann Taggart Robinson (1923-2009), and Barbara Jean Taggart (1928-2008). [3] [4] [5] [6]
